perturbation.original_text:
ARBITRATION
                                               Unless otherwise mutually agreed to in writing by the Company, Nantz Communications and Nantz, any controversy or claim arising out of or related to this Agreement, or the breach thereof, shall be settled by arbitration in accordance with the Rules of the American Arbitration Association or any successor.  Each of the Company, on the one hand, and Nantz Communications and Nantz, on the other hand, shall select one arbitrator and the two so selected shall select a third.  Failing the selection of an arbitrator by either party or by the two so selected, the claim or controversy shall be settled by the American Arbitration Association upon the application of either party.  Judgment upon any award of a majority of the arbitrators filed in a court of competent jurisdiction shall be binding.
perturbation.changed_text:
32. ARBITRATION (Optional).
                                               In the unlikely event of a dispute, the parties may elect to engage in arbitration. Should all parties agree, any controversy or claim arising out of or related to this Agreement, or the breach thereof, may be settled by arbitration. The judgment upon any award rendered by the arbitrator(s) may be filed in a court of competent jurisdiction. This clause is entirely optional and does not obligate any party to participate in arbitration.
perturbation.explanation: The original arbitration clause mandates arbitration. The modified clause makes arbitration optional, contradicting the original intent and potentially violating requirements for clear dispute resolution procedures. It also places the clause in the 'MISCELLANEOUS' section, renamed it Arbitration (Optional), further obscuring its importance.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles regarding dispute resolution clarity and enforceability.

GOVERNING LAW.  This Agreement and its formation, operation and performance
      shall be governed, construed, performed, and enforced in accordance with
      the laws of the State of California.

26.  JURISDICTION AND VENUE.  For the purposes of any dispute arising hereunder,
      jurisdiction and venue shall lie in the appropriate court in California.
perturbation.changed_text:
GOVERNING LAW.  This Agreement and its formation, operation and performance
      shall be governed, construed, performed, and enforced in accordance with
      the laws of the State of Delaware.

26.  JURISDICTION AND VENUE.  For the purposes of any dispute arising hereunder,
      jurisdiction and venue shall lie in the appropriate court in New York.
perturbation.explanation: The governing law and jurisdiction are changed to Delaware and New York respectively, despite the company being located in California, which creates jurisdictional confusion.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract law principles regarding choice of law and jurisdiction reflecting the location of business or the subject of agreement.
